02449       INT32 iCounter = 0;
02450       CHAR16 sString[ 128 ];
02451 
02452       if( ( pPatient->sSectorX != gWorldSectorX ) || ( pPatient->sSectorY != gWorldSectorY ) || ( pPatient->bSectorZ != gbWorldSectorZ ) )
02453       {
02454             // not currently loaded
02455             return( TRUE );
02456       }
02457 
02458       for( iCounter = 0; iCounter < MAX_CHARACTER_COUNT; iCounter++ )
02459       {
02460             pSoldier = &Menptr[ iCounter ];
02461 
02462             if( pSoldier->bActive )
02463             {
02464 
02465                   // are they two of these guys in the same sector?
02466                   if( ( pSoldier->sSectorX == pPatient->sSectorX ) && ( pSoldier->sSectorY == pPatient->sSectorY ) && ( pSoldier->bSectorZ == pPatient->bSectorZ ) )
02467                   {
02468 
02469                         // is a doctor
02470                         if( pSoldier->bAssignment == DOCTOR )
02471                         {
02472 
02473                               // the doctor is in the house
02474                               fDoctorInSector = TRUE;
02475 
02476                               // can this patient be healed by the doctor?
02477                               if( CanSoldierBeHealedByDoctor( pPatient, pSoldier, TRUE, HEALABLE_EVER, FALSE, FALSE ) == TRUE )
02478                               {
02479                                     // yep
02480                                     fDoctorCloseEnough = TRUE;
02481                               }
02482                         }
02483                   }
02484             }
02485       }
02486 
02487       // there are doctors here but noone can heal this guy
02488       if( ( fDoctorInSector ) && ( fDoctorCloseEnough == FALSE ) )
02489       {
02490             swprintf( sString, pDoctorWarningString[ 0 ] , pPatient->name );
02491             DoScreenIndependantMessageBox( sString, MSG_BOX_FLAG_OK, NULL);
02492             return( FALSE );
02493       }
02494 
02495       return( TRUE );
02496 }
02497 */
02498 
02499 
02500 BOOLEAN CanSoldierBeHealedByDoctor( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, SOLDIERTYPE *pDoctor, BOOLEAN fIgnoreAssignment, BOOLEAN fThisHour, BOOLEAN fSkipKitCheck, BOOLEAN fSkipSkillCheck )
02501 {
02502       INT16 sDistance = 0;
02503 
02504       // must be an active guy
02505       if (pSoldier -> bActive == FALSE)
02506       {
02507             return(FALSE);
02508       }
02509 
02510       // must be a patient or a doctor
02511       if( ( pSoldier -> bAssignment != PATIENT ) && ( pSoldier -> bAssignment != DOCTOR ) && ( fIgnoreAssignment == FALSE ) )
02512       {
02513             return(FALSE);
02514       }
02515 
02516       // if dead or unhurt
02517       if ( (pSoldier -> bLife == 0) || (pSoldier -> bLife == pSoldier -> bLifeMax ) )
02518       {
02519             return(FALSE);
02520       }
02521 
02522       // if we care about how long it's been, and he hasn't been on a healable assignment long enough
02523       if( fThisHour && ( EnoughTimeOnAssignment( pSoldier ) == FALSE ) && ( fIgnoreAssignment == FALSE ) )
02524       {
02525             return( FALSE );
02526       }
02527 
02528       // must be in the same sector
02529       if( ( pSoldier -> sSectorX != pDoctor -> sSectorX ) || ( pSoldier -> sSectorY != pDoctor -> sSectorY ) || ( pSoldier -> bSectorZ != pDoctor -> bSectorZ ) )
02530       {
02531             return(FALSE);
02532       }
02533 
02534       // can't be between sectors (possible to get here if ignoring assignment)
02535       if ( pSoldier->fBetweenSectors )
02536       {
02537             return(FALSE);
02538       }
02539 
02540       // if doctor's skill is unsufficient to save this guy
02541       if ( !fSkipSkillCheck && ( pDoctor -> bMedical < GetMinHealingSkillNeeded( pSoldier ) ) )
02542       {
02543             return(FALSE);
02544       }
02545 
02546       if ( !fSkipKitCheck && ( FindMedKit( pDoctor ) == NO_SLOT ) )
02547       {
02548             // no medical kit to use!
02549             return( FALSE );
02550       }
02551       
02552       return( TRUE );
02553 }
02554 
02555 
02556 UINT8 GetMinHealingSkillNeeded( SOLDIERTYPE *pPatient )
02557 {
02558       // get the minimum skill to handle a character under OKLIFE
02559 
02560       if( pPatient -> bLife < OKLIFE )
02561       {
02562             // less than ok life, return skill needed
02563             return( gGameExternalOptions.ubBaseMedicalSkillToDealWithEmergency + ( gGameExternalOptions.ubMultiplierForDifferenceInLifeValueForEmergency * ( OKLIFE - pPatient -> bLife ) ) );
02564       }
02565       else
02566       {
02567             // only need some skill
02568             return ( 1 );
02569       }
02570 }
02571 
02572 
02573 UINT16 HealPatient( SOLDIERTYPE *pPatient, SOLDIERTYPE * pDoctor, UINT16 usHundredthsHealed )
02574 {
02575       // heal patient and return the number of healing pts used
02576       UINT16 usHealingPtsLeft;
02577       UINT16 usTotalFullPtsUsed = 0;
02578       UINT16 usTotalHundredthsUsed = 0;
02579       INT8 bPointsToUse = 0;
02580       INT8 bPointsUsed = 0;
02581       INT8 bPointsHealed = 0;
02582       INT8 bPocket = 0;
02583       INT8 bMedFactor;
02584 //    INT8 bOldPatientLife = pPatient -> bLife;
02585 
02586 
02587       pPatient->sFractLife += usHundredthsHealed;
02588       usTotalHundredthsUsed = usHundredthsHealed;           // we'll subtract any unused amount later if we become fully healed...
02589 
02590       // convert fractions into full points
02591       usHealingPtsLeft = pPatient->sFractLife / 100;
02592       pPatient->sFractLife %= 100;
02593 
02594       // if we haven't accumulated any full points yet
02595       if (usHealingPtsLeft == 0)
02596       {
02597             return( usTotalHundredthsUsed );
02598       }
02599 
02600 
02601 /* ARM - Eliminated.  We now have other methods of properly using doctors to auto-bandage bleeding,
02602 // using the correct kits points instead of this 1 pt. "special"
02603 
02604       // stop all bleeding of patient..for 1 pt (it's fast).  But still use up normal kit pts to do it
02605       if (pPatient -> bBleeding > 0)
02606       {
02607             usHealingPtsLeft--;
02608             usTotalFullPtsUsed++;
02609 
02610             // get points needed to heal him to dress bleeding wounds
02611             bPointsToUse = pPatient -> bBleeding;
02612 
02613             // go through doctor's pockets and heal, starting at with his in-hand item
02614             // the healing pts are based on what type of medkit is in his hand, so we HAVE to start there first!
02615             for (bPocket = HANDPOS; bPocket <= SMALLPOCK8POS; bPocket++)
02616             {
02617                   bMedFactor = IsMedicalKitItem( &( pDoctor -> inv[ bPocket ] ) );
02618                   if ( bMedFactor > 0 )
02619                   {
02620                         // ok, we have med kit in this pocket, use it
02621 
02622                         // The medFactor here doesn't affect how much the doctor can heal (that's already factored into lower healing pts)
02623                         // but it does effect how fast the medkit is used up!  First aid kits disappear at double their doctoring rate!
02624                         bPointsUsed = (INT8) UseKitPoints( &( pDoctor -> inv[ bPocket ] ), (UINT16) (bPointsToUse * bMedFactor), pDoctor );
02625                         bPointsHealed = bPointsUsed / bMedFactor;
02626 
02627                         bPointsToUse -= bPointsHealed;
02628                         pPatient -> bBleeding -= bPointsHealed;
02629 
02630                         // if we're done all we're supposed to, or the guy's no longer bleeding, bail
02631                         if ( ( bPointsToUse <= 0 ) || ( pPatient -> bBleeding == 0 ) )
02632                         {
02633                               break;
02634                         }
02635                   }
02636             }
02637       }
02638 */
02639 
02640       // if below ok life, heal these first at double point cost
02641       if( pPatient -> bLife < OKLIFE )
02642       {
02643             // get points needed to heal him to OKLIFE
02644             bPointsToUse = gGameExternalOptions.ubPointCostPerHealthBelowOkLife * ( OKLIFE - pPatient -> bLife );
02645 
02646             // if he needs more than we have, reduce to that
02647             if( bPointsToUse > usHealingPtsLeft )
02648             {
02649               bPointsToUse = ( INT8 )usHealingPtsLeft;
02650             }
02651 
02652             // go through doctor's pockets and heal, starting at with his in-hand item
02653             // the healing pts are based on what type of medkit is in his hand, so we HAVE to start there first!
02654             for (bPocket = HANDPOS; bPocket <= SMALLPOCK8POS; bPocket++)
02655             {
02656                   bMedFactor = IsMedicalKitItem( &( pDoctor -> inv[ bPocket ] ) );
02657                   if ( bMedFactor > 0 )
02658                   {
02659                         // ok, we have med kit in this pocket, use it
02660 
02661                         // The medFactor here doesn't affect how much the doctor can heal (that's already factored into lower healing pts)
02662                         // but it does effect how fast the medkit is used up!  First aid kits disappear at double their doctoring rate!
02663                         bPointsUsed = (INT8) UseKitPoints( &( pDoctor -> inv[ bPocket ] ), (UINT16) (bPointsToUse * bMedFactor), pDoctor );
02664                         bPointsHealed = bPointsUsed / bMedFactor;
02665 
02666                         bPointsToUse -= bPointsHealed;
02667                         usHealingPtsLeft -= bPointsHealed;
02668                         usTotalFullPtsUsed += bPointsHealed;
02669 
02670                         // heal person the amount / POINT_COST_PER_HEALTH_BELOW_OKLIFE
02671                         pPatient -> bLife += (bPointsHealed / gGameExternalOptions.ubPointCostPerHealthBelowOkLife);
02672 
02673                         // if we're done all we're supposed to, or the guy's at OKLIFE, bail
02674                         if ( ( bPointsToUse <= 0 ) || ( pPatient -> bLife >= OKLIFE ) )
02675                         {
02676                               break;
02677                         }
02678                   }
02679             }
02680       }
02681 
02682       // critical conditions handled, now apply normal healing
02683 
02684       if (pPatient -> bLife < pPatient -> bLifeMax)
02685       {
02686             bPointsToUse = ( pPatient -> bLifeMax - pPatient -> bLife );
02687             
02688             // if guy is hurt more than points we have...heal only what we have 
02689             if( bPointsToUse > usHealingPtsLeft )
02690             {
02691                   bPointsToUse = ( INT8 )usHealingPtsLeft;
02692             }
02693 
02694             // go through doctor's pockets and heal, starting at with his in-hand item
02695             // the healing pts are based on what type of medkit is in his hand, so we HAVE to start there first!
02696             for (bPocket = HANDPOS; bPocket <= SMALLPOCK8POS; bPocket++)
02697             {
02698                   bMedFactor = IsMedicalKitItem( &( pDoctor -> inv[ bPocket ] ) );
02699                   if ( bMedFactor > 0 )
02700                   {
02701                         // ok, we have med kit in this pocket, use it  (use only half if it's worth double)
02702 
02703                         // The medFactor here doesn't affect how much the doctor can heal (that's already factored into lower healing pts)
02704                         // but it does effect how fast the medkit is used up!  First aid kits disappear at double their doctoring rate!
02705                         bPointsUsed = (INT8) UseKitPoints( &( pDoctor -> inv[ bPocket ] ), (UINT16) (bPointsToUse * bMedFactor), pDoctor );
02706                         bPointsHealed = bPointsUsed / bMedFactor;
02707 
02708                         bPointsToUse -= bPointsHealed;
02709                         usHealingPtsLeft -= bPointsHealed;
02710                         usTotalFullPtsUsed += bPointsHealed;
02711 
02712                         pPatient -> bLife += bPointsHealed;
02713 
02714                         // if we're done all we're supposed to, or the guy's fully healed, bail
02715                         if ( ( bPointsToUse <= 0 ) || ( pPatient -> bLife == pPatient -> bLifeMax ) )
02716                         {
02717                               break;
02718                         }
02719                   }
02720             }
02721       }
02722 
02723 
02724       // if this patient is fully healed
02725       if( pPatient->bLife == pPatient->bLifeMax )
02726       {
02727             // don't count unused full healing points as being used
02728             usTotalHundredthsUsed -= (100 * usHealingPtsLeft);
02729 
02730             // wipe out fractions of extra life, and DON'T count them as used
02731             usTotalHundredthsUsed -= pPatient->sFractLife;
02732             pPatient->sFractLife = 0;
02733 
02734 /* ARM Removed.  This is duplicating the check in UpdatePatientsWhoAreDoneHealing(), guy would show up twice!
02735             // if it isn't the doctor himself)
02736             if( ( pPatient != pDoctor )
02737             {
02738                   AssignmentDone( pPatient, TRUE, TRUE );
02739             }
02740 */
02741       }
02742 
02743       return ( usTotalHundredthsUsed );
02744 }
02745 
02746 
02747 void CheckForAndHandleHospitalPatients( void )
02748 {
02749       SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, *pTeamSoldier;
02750   INT32 cnt=0;
02751 
02752       if( fSectorsWithSoldiers[ HOSPITAL_SECTOR_X + HOSPITAL_SECTOR_Y * MAP_WORLD_X ][ 0 ] == FALSE )
02753       {
02754             // nobody in the hospital sector... leave
02755             return;
02756       }
02757 
02758       // set pSoldier as first in merc ptrs
02759       pSoldier = MercPtrs[0]; 
02760 
02761       // go through list of characters, find all who are on this assignment
02762       for ( pTeamSoldier = MercPtrs[ cnt ]; cnt <= gTacticalStatus.Team[ pSoldier -> bTeam ].bLastID; cnt++,pTeamSoldier++)
02763       {
02764             if( pTeamSoldier -> bActive )
02765             {
02766                   if ( pTeamSoldier -> bAssignment == ASSIGNMENT_HOSPITAL )
02767                   {
02768                         if ( ( pTeamSoldier -> sSectorX == HOSPITAL_SECTOR_X ) && ( pTeamSoldier -> sSectorY == HOSPITAL_SECTOR_Y ) && ( pTeamSoldier -> bSectorZ == 0 ) )
02769                         {
02770                               // heal this character
02771                               HealHospitalPatient( pTeamSoldier, gGameExternalOptions.ubHospitalHealingRate );
02772                         }
02773                   }
02774             }
02775       }
02776 }
02777 
02778 
02779 void HealHospitalPatient( SOLDIERTYPE *pPatient, UINT16 usHealingPtsLeft )
02780 {
02781       INT8 bPointsToUse;
02782 
02783       if (usHealingPtsLeft <= 0)
02784       {
02785             return;
02786       }
02787 
02788 /*  Stopping hospital patients' bleeding must be handled immediately, not during a regular hourly check
02789       // stop all bleeding of patient..for 1 pt.
02790       if (pPatient -> bBleeding > 0)
02791       {
02792             usHealingPtsLeft--;
02793             pPatient -> bBleeding = 0;
02794       }
02795 */
02796 
02797       // if below ok life, heal these first at double cost
02798       if( pPatient -> bLife < OKLIFE )
02799       {
02800             // get points needed to heal him to OKLIFE
02801             bPointsToUse = gGameExternalOptions.ubPointCostPerHealthBelowOkLife * ( OKLIFE - pPatient -> bLife );
02802 
02803             // if he needs more than we have, reduce to that
02804             if( bPointsToUse > usHealingPtsLeft )
02805             {
02806               bPointsToUse = ( INT8 )usHealingPtsLeft;
02807             }
02808 
02809             usHealingPtsLeft -= bPointsToUse;
02810 
02811             // heal person the amount / POINT_COST_PER_HEALTH_BELOW_OKLIFE
02812             pPatient -> bLife += ( bPointsToUse / gGameExternalOptions.ubPointCostPerHealthBelowOkLife );
02813       }
02814 
02815       // critical condition handled, now solve normal healing
02816 
02817       if ( pPatient -> bLife < pPatient -> bLifeMax )
02818       {
02819             bPointsToUse = ( pPatient -> bLifeMax - pPatient -> bLife );
02820             
02821             // if guy is hurt more than points we have...heal only what we have 
02822             if( bPointsToUse > usHealingPtsLeft )
02823             {
02824                   bPointsToUse = ( INT8 )usHealingPtsLeft;
02825             }
02826 
02827             usHealingPtsLeft -= bPointsToUse;
02828 
02829             // heal person the amount
02830             pPatient -> bLife += bPointsToUse;
02831       }
02832 
02833       // if this patient is fully healed
02834       if ( pPatient -> bLife == pPatient -> bLifeMax )
02835       {
02836             AssignmentDone( pPatient, TRUE, TRUE );
02837       }
02838 }
02839 
02840 
02841 void HandleRepairmenInSector( INT16 sX, INT16 sY, INT8 bZ )
02842 {
02843       SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, *pTeamSoldier;
02844   INT32 cnt=0;
02845       INT32 iCounter=0;
02846 
02847       // set psoldier as first in merc ptrs
02848       pSoldier = MercPtrs[0]; 
02849 
02850       // will handle doctor/patient relationship in sector
02851 
02852       // go through list of characters, find all doctors in sector
02853       for ( pTeamSoldier = MercPtrs[ cnt ]; cnt <= gTacticalStatus.Team[ pSoldier -> bTeam ].bLastID; cnt++,pTeamSoldier++)
02854       {
02855             if( pTeamSoldier -> bActive )
02856             {
02857                   if( ( pTeamSoldier -> sSectorX == sX ) && ( pTeamSoldier -> sSectorY == sY ) && ( pTeamSoldier -> bSectorZ == bZ) )
02858                   {
02859                         if ( ( pTeamSoldier -> bAssignment == REPAIR ) && ( pTeamSoldier->fMercAsleep == FALSE ) )
02860                         {
02861                               MakeSureToolKitIsInHand( pTeamSoldier );
02862                               // character is in sector, check if can repair
02863                               if ( CanCharacterRepair( pTeamSoldier ) && ( EnoughTimeOnAssignment( pTeamSoldier ) ) )
02864                               {
02865                                     HandleRepairBySoldier( pTeamSoldier );
02866                               }
02867                         }
02868                   }
02869             }
02870       }
02871 
02872       return;
02873 }
02874 
02875 
02876 /* No point in allowing SAM site repair any more.  Jan/13/99.  ARM
02877 INT8 HandleRepairOfSAMSite( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, INT8 bPointsAvailable, BOOLEAN * pfNothingLeftToRepair )
02878 {
02879       INT8 bPtsUsed = 0;
02880       INT16 sStrategicSector = 0;
02881 
02882       if( IsThisSectorASAMSector( pSoldier -> sSectorX, pSoldier -> sSectorY, pSoldier -> bSectorZ ) == FALSE )
02883       {
02884             return( bPtsUsed );
02885       }
02886       else if( ( pSoldier -> sSectorX == gWorldSectorX ) && ( pSoldier -> bSectorZ == gbWorldSectorZ )&&( pSoldier -> sSectorY == gWorldSectorY ) )
02887       {
02888             if( CanSoldierRepairSAM( pSoldier, bPointsAvailable ) == FALSE )
02889             {
02890                   return( bPtsUsed );
02891             }
02892       }
02893 
02894       // repair the SAM
02895 
02896       sStrategicSector = CALCULATE_STRATEGIC_INDEX( pSoldier->sSectorX, pSoldier->sSectorY );
02897 
02898       // do we have more than enough?
02899       if( 100 - StrategicMap[ sStrategicSector ].bSAMCondition >= bPointsAvailable / SAM_SITE_REPAIR_DIVISOR )
02900       {
02901             // no, use up all we have
02902             StrategicMap[ sStrategicSector ].bSAMCondition += bPointsAvailable / SAM_SITE_REPAIR_DIVISOR;
02903             bPtsUsed = bPointsAvailable - ( bPointsAvailable % SAM_SITE_REPAIR_DIVISOR );
02904 
02905             // SAM site may have been put back into working order...
02906             UpdateAirspaceControl( );
02907       }
02908       else
02909       {
02910             // yep
02911             bPtsUsed = SAM_SITE_REPAIR_DIVISOR * ( 100 - StrategicMap[ sStrategicSector ].bSAMCondition );
02912             StrategicMap[ sStrategicSector ].bSAMCondition = 100;
02913 
02914 //ARM: NOTE THAT IF THIS CODE IS EVER RE-ACTIVATED, THE SAM GRAPHICS SHOULD CHANGE NOT WHEN THE SAM SITE RETURNS TO
02915 // FULL STRENGTH (condition 100), but as soon as it reaches MIN_CONDITION_TO_FIX_SAM!!!
02916 
02917             // Bring Hit points back up to full, adjust graphic to full graphic.....
02918             UpdateSAMDoneRepair( pSoldier -> sSectorX, pSoldier -> sSectorY, pSoldier -> bSectorZ );
02919       }
02920 
02921       if ( StrategicMap[ sStrategicSector ].bSAMCondition == 100 )
02922       {
02923             *pfNothingLeftToRepair = TRUE;
02924       }
02925       else
02926       {
02927             *pfNothingLeftToRepair = FALSE;
02928       }
02929       return( bPtsUsed );
02930 }
02931 */
02932 
02933 
02934 
02935 INT8 FindRepairableItemOnOtherSoldier( SOLDIERTYPE * pSoldier, UINT8 ubPassType )
02936 {
02937       INT8 bLoop, bLoop2;
02938       REPAIR_PASS_SLOTS_TYPE *pPassList;
02939       INT8 bSlotToCheck;
02940       OBJECTTYPE * pObj;
02941 
02942 
02943       Assert( ubPassType < NUM_REPAIR_PASS_TYPES );
02944 
02945       pPassList = &( gRepairPassSlotList[ ubPassType ] );
02946 
02947       for ( bLoop = 0; bLoop < pPassList->ubChoices; bLoop++ )
02948       {
02949             bSlotToCheck = pPassList->bSlot[ bLoop ];
02950             Assert( bSlotToCheck != -1 );
02951 
02952             pObj = &( pSoldier->inv[ bSlotToCheck ] );
02953             for ( bLoop2 = 0; bLoop2 < pSoldier->inv[ bSlotToCheck ].ubNumberOfObjects; bLoop2++ )
02954             {
02955                   if ( IsItemRepairable( pObj->usItem, pObj->bStatus[bLoop2] ) )
02956                   {
02957                         return( bSlotToCheck );
02958                   }
02959             }     
02960 
02961             // have to check for attachments...
02962             for ( bLoop2 = 0; bLoop2 < MAX_ATTACHMENTS; bLoop2++ )
02963             {
02964                   if ( pObj->usAttachItem[ bLoop2 ] != NOTHING )
02965                   {
02966                         if ( IsItemRepairable( pObj->usAttachItem[ bLoop2 ], pObj->bAttachStatus[ bLoop2 ] ) )
02967                         {
02968                               return( bSlotToCheck );
02969                         }           
02970                   }
02971             }
02972       }
02973 
02974       return( NO_SLOT );
02975 }
02976 
02977 
02978 
02979 void DoActualRepair( SOLDIERTYPE * pSoldier, UINT16 usItem, INT8 * pbStatus, UINT8 * pubRepairPtsLeft )
02980 {
02981       INT16       sRepairCostAdj;
02982       UINT16      usDamagePts, usPtsFixed;
02983 
02984       // get item's repair ease, for each + point is 10% easier, each - point is 10% harder to repair
02985       sRepairCostAdj = 100 - ( 10 * Item[ usItem ].bRepairEase );
02986 
02987       // make sure it ain't somehow gone too low!
02988       if (sRepairCostAdj < 10)
02989       {
02990             sRepairCostAdj = 10;
02991       }
02992 
02993       // repairs on electronic items take twice as long if the guy doesn't have the skill
02994 //    if ( ( Item[ usItem ].fFlags & ITEM_ELECTRONIC ) && ( !( HAS_SKILL_TRAIT( pSoldier, ELECTRONICS ) ) ) )
02995       if ( ( Item[ usItem ].electronic ) && ( !( HAS_SKILL_TRAIT( pSoldier, ELECTRONICS ) ) ) )
02996       {
02997             sRepairCostAdj *= 2;
02998       }
02999 
03000       // how many points of damage is the item down by?
03001       usDamagePts = 100 - *pbStatus;
03002 
03003       // adjust that by the repair cost adjustment percentage
03004       usDamagePts = (usDamagePts * sRepairCostAdj) / 100;
03005 
03006       // do we have enough pts to fully repair the item?
03007       if ( *pubRepairPtsLeft >= usDamagePts )
03008       {
03009             // fix it to 100%
03010             *pbStatus = 100;
03011             *pubRepairPtsLeft -= usDamagePts;
03012       }
03013       else  // not enough, partial fix only, if any at all
03014       {
03015             // fix what we can - add pts left adjusted by the repair cost
03016             usPtsFixed = ( *pubRepairPtsLeft * 100 ) / sRepairCostAdj;
03017 
03018             // if we have enough to actually fix anything
03019             // NOTE: a really crappy repairman with only 1 pt/hr CAN'T repair electronics or difficult items!
03020             if (usPtsFixed > 0)
03021             {
03022                   *pbStatus += usPtsFixed;
03023 
03024                   // make sure we don't somehow end up over 100
03025                   if ( *pbStatus > 100 )
03026                   {
03027                         *pbStatus = 100;
03028                   }
03029             }
03030 
03031             *pubRepairPtsLeft = 0;
03032       }
03033 }
03034 
03035 
03036 
03037 BOOLEAN RepairObject( SOLDIERTYPE * pSoldier, SOLDIERTYPE * pOwner, OBJECTTYPE * pObj, UINT8 * pubRepairPtsLeft )
03038 {
03039       UINT8 ubLoop, ubItemsInPocket;
03040       BOOLEAN fSomethingWasRepaired = FALSE;
03041 
03042 
03043       ubItemsInPocket = pObj->ubNumberOfObjects;
03044 
03045       for ( ubLoop = 0; ubLoop < ubItemsInPocket; ubLoop++ )
03046       {
03047             // if it's repairable and NEEDS repairing
03048             if ( IsItemRepairable( pObj->usItem, pObj->bStatus[ubLoop] ) )
03049             {
03050                   // repairable, try to repair it
03051 
03052                   //void DoActualRepair( SOLDIERTYPE * pSoldier, UINT16 usItem, INT8 * pbStatus, UINT8 * pubRepairPtsLeft )
03053                   DoActualRepair( pSoldier, pObj->usItem, &(pObj->bStatus[ ubLoop ]), pubRepairPtsLeft );
03054 
03055                   fSomethingWasRepaired = TRUE;
03056 
03057                   if ( pObj->bStatus[ ubLoop ] == 100 )
03058                   {
03059                         // report it as fixed
03060                         if ( pSoldier == pOwner )
03061                         {
03062                               ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_LTYELLOW, MSG_INTERFACE, Message[ STR_REPAIRED ], pSoldier->name, ItemNames[ pObj->usItem ] );
03063                         }
03064                         else
03065                         {
03066                               // NOTE: may need to be changed for localized versions
03067                               ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_LTYELLOW, MSG_INTERFACE, gzLateLocalizedString[ 35 ], pSoldier->name, pOwner->name, ItemNames[ pObj->usItem ] );
03068                         }
03069                   }
03070 
03071                   if ( *pubRepairPtsLeft == 0 )
03072                   {
03073                         // we're out of points!
03074                         break;
03075                   }
03076             }           
03077       }
03078 
03079       // now check for attachments
03080       for ( ubLoop = 0; ubLoop < MAX_ATTACHMENTS; ubLoop++ )
03081       {
03082             if ( pObj->usAttachItem[ ubLoop ] != NOTHING )
03083             {
03084                   if ( IsItemRepairable( pObj->usAttachItem[ ubLoop ], pObj->bAttachStatus[ ubLoop ] ) )
03085                   {
03086                         // repairable, try to repair it
03087 
03088                         DoActualRepair( pSoldier, pObj->usAttachItem[ ubLoop ], &(pObj->bAttachStatus[ ubLoop ]), pubRepairPtsLeft );
03089 
03090                         fSomethingWasRepaired = TRUE;
03091 
03092                         if ( pObj->bAttachStatus[ ubLoop ] == 100 )
03093                         {
03094                               // report it as fixed
03095                               if ( pSoldier == pOwner )
03096                               {
03097                                     ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_LTYELLOW, MSG_INTERFACE, Message[ STR_REPAIRED ], pSoldier->name, ItemNames[ pObj->usAttachItem[ ubLoop ] ] );
03098                               }
03099                               else
03100                               {
03101                                     // NOTE: may need to be changed for localized versions
03102                                     ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_LTYELLOW, MSG_INTERFACE, gzLateLocalizedString[ 35 ], pSoldier->name, pOwner->name, ItemNames[ pObj->usAttachItem[ ubLoop ] ] );
03103                               }
03104                         }
03105 
03106                         if ( *pubRepairPtsLeft == 0 )
03107                         {
03108                               // we're out of points!
03109                               break;
03110                         }
03111                   }           
03112             }
03113       }
03114       
03115       return( fSomethingWasRepaired );
03116 }
03117 
03118 
03119 void HandleRepairBySoldier( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier )
03120 {
03121       UINT16 usMax=0;
03122       UINT8 ubRepairPtsLeft =0;
03123       UINT8 ubItemsInPocket = 0;
03124       UINT8 ubObjectInPocketCounter = 0;
03125       UINT8 ubInitialRepairPts = 0;
03126       UINT8 ubRepairPtsUsed = 0;
03127       INT8 bPocket =0;
03128       BOOLEAN fNothingLeftToRepair = FALSE;
03129       INT8  bLoop, bLoopStart, bLoopEnd;
03130       BOOLEAN fAnyOfSoldiersOwnItemsWereFixed = FALSE;
03131       OBJECTTYPE * pObj;
03132 
03133 
03134       // grab max number of repair pts open to this soldier
03135   ubRepairPtsLeft = CalculateRepairPointsForRepairman( pSoldier, &usMax, TRUE );
03136 
03137       // no points
03138   if ( ubRepairPtsLeft == 0 )
03139       {
03140             AssignmentDone( pSoldier, TRUE, TRUE );
03141     return;
03142       }
03143 
03144       // remember what we've started off with
03145       ubInitialRepairPts = ubRepairPtsLeft;
03146       
03147       // check if we are repairing a vehicle
03148       if ( pSoldier->bVehicleUnderRepairID != -1 )
03149       {
03150             if ( CanCharacterRepairVehicle( pSoldier, pSoldier->bVehicleUnderRepairID ) )
03151             {
03152                   // attempt to fix vehicle
03153                   ubRepairPtsLeft -= RepairVehicle( pSoldier->bVehicleUnderRepairID, ubRepairPtsLeft, &fNothingLeftToRepair );
03154             }
03155       }     
03156       // check if we are repairing a robot
03157       else if( pSoldier->fFixingRobot )
03158       {
03159             if ( CanCharacterRepairRobot( pSoldier ) )
03160             {
03161                   // repairing the robot is very slow & difficult
03162                   ubRepairPtsLeft /= 2;
03163                   ubInitialRepairPts /= 2;
03164 
03165                   if( !( HAS_SKILL_TRAIT( pSoldier, ELECTRONICS ) ) )
03166                   {
03167                         ubRepairPtsLeft /= 2;
03168                         ubInitialRepairPts /= 2;
03169                   }
03170 
03171                   // robot
03172                   ubRepairPtsLeft -= HandleRepairOfRobotBySoldier( pSoldier, ubRepairPtsLeft, &fNothingLeftToRepair );
03173             }
03174       }
03175       else
03176       {
03177             fAnyOfSoldiersOwnItemsWereFixed = UnjamGunsOnSoldier( pSoldier, pSoldier, &ubRepairPtsLeft );
03178 
03179             // repair items on self
03180             for( bLoop = 0; bLoop < 2; bLoop++ )
03181             {
03182                   if ( bLoop == 0 )
03183                   {
03184                         bLoopStart = SECONDHANDPOS;
03185                         bLoopEnd = SMALLPOCK8POS;
03186                   }
03187                   else
03188                   {
03189                         bLoopStart = HELMETPOS;
03190                         bLoopEnd = HEAD2POS;
03191                   }
03192 
03193                   // now repair objects running from left hand to small pocket
03194                   for( bPocket = bLoopStart; bPocket <= bLoopEnd; bPocket++ )
03195                   {
03196                         pObj = &(pSoldier->inv[ bPocket ]);
03197 
03198                         if ( RepairObject( pSoldier, pSoldier, pObj, &ubRepairPtsLeft ) )
03199                         {
03200                               fAnyOfSoldiersOwnItemsWereFixed = TRUE;
03201 
03202                               // quit looking if we're already out
03203                               if ( ubRepairPtsLeft == 0 )
03204                                     break;
03205                         }
03206                   }
03207             }
03208 
03209             // if he fixed something of his, and now has no more of his own items to fix
03210             if ( fAnyOfSoldiersOwnItemsWereFixed && !DoesCharacterHaveAnyItemsToRepair( pSoldier, -1 ) )
03211             {
03212                   ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_LTYELLOW, MSG_INTERFACE, sRepairsDoneString[ 0 ], pSoldier->name );
03213 
03214                   // let player react
03215                   StopTimeCompression();
03216             }
03217 
03218 
03219             // repair items on others
03220             RepairItemsOnOthers( pSoldier, &ubRepairPtsLeft );
03221       }
03222 
03223       // what are the total amount of pts used by character?
03224   ubRepairPtsUsed = ubInitialRepairPts - ubRepairPtsLeft;
03225       if( ubRepairPtsUsed > 0 )
03226       {
03227             // improve stats
03228             StatChange( pSoldier, MECHANAMT, ( UINT16 ) (ubRepairPtsUsed / 2), FALSE );
03229             StatChange( pSoldier, DEXTAMT,       ( UINT16 ) (ubRepairPtsUsed / 2), FALSE );
03230 
03231             // check if kit damaged/depleted
03232             if( ( Random( 100 ) ) < (UINT32) (ubRepairPtsUsed * 5) ) // CJC: added a x5 as this wasn't going down anywhere fast enough
03233             {
03234                   // kit item damaged/depleted, burn up points of toolkit..which is in right hand
03235                   UseKitPoints( &( pSoldier -> inv[ HANDPOS ] ), 1, pSoldier );
03236             }
03237       }
03238 
03239 
03240       // if he really done
03241       if ( HasCharacterFinishedRepairing( pSoldier ) )
03242       {
03243             // yup, that's all folks
03244             AssignmentDone( pSoldier, TRUE, TRUE );
03245       }
03246       else  // still has stuff to repair
03247       {
03248             // if nothing got repaired, there's a problem
03249             if ( ubRepairPtsUsed == 0 )
03250             {
03251                   // see if not having a toolkit is the problem
03252                   if ( FindToolkit( pSoldier ) == NO_SLOT )
03253                   {
03254                         // he could (maybe) repair something, but can't because he doesn't have a tool kit!
03255                         AssignmentAborted( pSoldier, NO_MORE_TOOL_KITS );
03256                   }
03257                   else
03258                   {
03259                         // he can't repair anything because he doesn't have enough skill!
03260                         AssignmentAborted( pSoldier, INSUF_REPAIR_SKILL );
03261                   }
03262             }
03263       }
03264 
03265       return;
03266 }
03267 
03268 
03269 
03270 BOOLEAN IsItemRepairable( UINT16 usItem, INT8 bStatus )
03271 {
03272       // check to see if item can/needs to be repaired
03273 //    if ( ( bStatus < 100) && ( Item[ usItem ].fFlags & ITEM_REPAIRABLE ) )
03274       if ( ( bStatus < 100) && ( Item[ usItem ].repairable  ) )
03275       {
03276             // yep
03277             return ( TRUE );
03278       }
03279 
03280       // nope
03281       return ( FALSE );
03282 }
03283 
03284 
03285 void HandleRestAndFatigueInSector( INT16 sMapX, INT16 sMapY, INT8 bMapZ )
03286 {
03287       // this will handle all sleeping characters in this sector
03288       SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, *pTeamSoldier;
03289   INT32 cnt=0;
03290 
03291       pSoldier = MercPtrs[0]; 
03292       
03293       // go through list of characters, find all sleepers in sector
03294       for ( pTeamSoldier = MercPtrs[ cnt ]; cnt <= gTacticalStatus.Team[ pSoldier -> bTeam ].bLastID; cnt++,pTeamSoldier++)
03295       {
03296             if( ( pTeamSoldier -> bActive ) && ( pSoldier -> bAssignment != ASSIGNMENT_POW ) )
03297             {
03298                   if( ( pTeamSoldier -> sSectorX == sMapX ) && ( pTeamSoldier -> sSectorY == sMapY ) && ( pTeamSoldier -> bSectorZ == bMapZ ) )
03299                   {
03300                   }
03301             }
03302       }
03303 }
03304 
03305 
03306 /*
03307 INT8 GetRegainDueToSleepNeeded( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, INT32 iRateOfReGain )
03308 {
03309       // look at persons regain rate,
03310       // if they infact loses sleep, make sure it doesn't go below the current rate
03311       INT8 bRate = 0;
03312       UINT8 ubNeedForSleep = 0;
03313 
03314       // get profile id and then grab sleep need value
03315       ubNeedForSleep = gMercProfiles[ pSoldier -> ubProfile ].ubNeedForSleep;
03316       
03317       bRate = ( AVG_NUMBER_OF_HOURS_OF_SLEEP_NEEDED - ( INT8 )ubNeedForSleep );
03318             
03319       if( bRate >= iRateOfReGain )
03320       {
03321             bRate = ( - iRateOfReGain ) + 1;
03322       }
03323       return( bRate );
03324 }
03325 */
03326 
03327 
03328 
03329 void RestCharacter( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier )
03330 {
03331       // handle the sleep of this character, update bBreathMax based on sleep they have
03332       INT8 bMaxBreathRegain = 0;
03333 
03334       bMaxBreathRegain = 50 / CalcSoldierNeedForSleep( pSoldier );
03335 
03336       // if breath max is below the "really tired" threshold
03337       if( pSoldier -> bBreathMax < BREATHMAX_PRETTY_TIRED )
03338       {
03339             // real tired, rest rate is 50% higher (this is to prevent absurdly long sleep times for totally exhausted mercs)
03340             bMaxBreathRegain = ( bMaxBreathRegain * 3 / 2 );
03341       }
03342 
03343       pSoldier -> bBreathMax += bMaxBreathRegain;
03344 
03345 
03346       if( pSoldier -> bBreathMax > 100 )
03347       {
03348             pSoldier -> bBreathMax = 100;
03349       }
03350       else if( pSoldier -> bBreathMax < BREATHMAX_ABSOLUTE_MINIMUM )
03351       {
03352             pSoldier -> bBreathMax = BREATHMAX_ABSOLUTE_MINIMUM;
03353       }
03354 
03355       pSoldier -> bBreath = pSoldier -> bBreathMax; 
03356 
03357 
03358       if ( pSoldier-> bBreathMax >= BREATHMAX_CANCEL_TIRED )
03359       {
03360             pSoldier->fComplainedThatTired = FALSE;
03361       }
03362 
03363       return;
03364 }
03365 
03366 
03367 void FatigueCharacter( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier )
03368 {
03369       // fatigue character
03370       INT32 iPercentEncumbrance;
03371       INT32 iBreathLoss;
03372       INT8 bMaxBreathLoss = 0, bDivisor = 1;
03373 
03374       
03375       // vehicle or robot?
03376       if( ( pSoldier -> uiStatusFlags & SOLDIER_VEHICLE ) || AM_A_ROBOT( pSoldier ) )
03377       {
03378             return;
03379       }
03380 
03381       // check if in transit, do not wear out
03382       if( IsCharacterInTransit( pSoldier ) == TRUE )
03383       {
03384             return;
03385       }
03386 
03387       // POW?
03388       if( pSoldier -> bAssignment == ASSIGNMENT_POW )
03389       {
03390             return;
03391       }
03392 
03393 
03394       bDivisor = 24 - CalcSoldierNeedForSleep( pSoldier );
03395       bMaxBreathLoss = 50 / bDivisor;
03396 
03397       if( bMaxBreathLoss < 2 )
03398       {
03399             bMaxBreathLoss = 2;
03400       }
03401 
03402       //KM: Added encumbrance calculation to soldiers moving on foot.  Anything above 100% will increase
03403       //    rate of fatigue.  200% encumbrance will cause soldiers to tire twice as quickly.
03404       if( pSoldier->fBetweenSectors && pSoldier->bAssignment != VEHICLE )
03405       { //Soldier is on foot and travelling.  Factor encumbrance into fatigue rate.
03406             iPercentEncumbrance = CalculateCarriedWeight( pSoldier );
03407             if( iPercentEncumbrance > 100 )
03408             {
03409                   iBreathLoss = (bMaxBreathLoss * iPercentEncumbrance / 100);
03410                   bMaxBreathLoss = (INT8)min( 127, iBreathLoss );
03411             }
03412       }
03413 
03414       // if breath max is below the "really tired" threshold
03415       if( pSoldier -> bBreathMax < BREATHMAX_PRETTY_TIRED )
03416       {
03417             // real tired, fatigue rate is 50% higher
03418             bMaxBreathLoss = ( bMaxBreathLoss * 3 / 2 );
03419       }
03420 
03421 
03422       pSoldier -> bBreathMax -= bMaxBreathLoss;
03423 
03424       if( pSoldier -> bBreathMax > 100 )
03425       {
03426             pSoldier -> bBreathMax = 100;
03427       }
03428       else if( pSoldier -> bBreathMax < BREATHMAX_ABSOLUTE_MINIMUM )
03429       {
03430             pSoldier -> bBreathMax = BREATHMAX_ABSOLUTE_MINIMUM;
03431       }
03432       
03433       // current breath can't exceed maximum
03434       if( pSoldier -> bBreath > pSoldier -> bBreathMax )
03435       {
03436             pSoldier -> bBreath = pSoldier -> bBreathMax; 
03437       }
03438 
03439       return;
03440 }
03441 
03442 
03443 // ONCE PER HOUR, will handle ALL kinds of training (self, teaching, and town) in this sector
03444 void HandleTrainingInSector( INT16 sMapX, INT16 sMapY, INT8 bZ )
03445 {
03446       SOLDIERTYPE *pTrainer;
03447       SOLDIERTYPE *pStudent;
03448       UINT8 ubStat;
03449       BOOLEAN fAtGunRange = FALSE;
03450   UINT32 uiCnt=0;
03451       INT16 sTotalTrainingPts = 0;
03452       INT16 sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor = 0;
03453       SOLDIERTYPE *pStatTrainerList[ NUM_TRAINABLE_STATS ];       // can't have more "best" trainers than trainable stats
03454       INT16 sBestTrainingPts;
03455       INT16 sTownTrainingPts;
03456       TOWN_TRAINER_TYPE TownTrainer[ MAX_CHARACTER_COUNT ];
03457       UINT8 ubTownTrainers;
03458       UINT16 usMaxPts;
03459       BOOLEAN fSamSiteInSector = FALSE;
03460       BOOLEAN fTrainingCompleted = FALSE;
03461 
03462 
03463       // find out if a sam site here
03464       fSamSiteInSector = IsThisSectorASAMSector( sMapX, sMapY, 0 );
03465 
03466       // Training in underground sectors is disallowed by the interface code, so there should never be any
03467       if (bZ != 0)
03468       {
03469             return;
03470       }
03471 
03472       // if sector not under our control, has enemies in it, or is currently in combat mode
03473       if (!SectorOursAndPeaceful( sMapX, sMapY, bZ ))
03474       {
03475             // then training is canceled for this hour.  
03476             // This is partly logical, but largely to prevent newly trained militia from appearing in mid-battle
03477             return;
03478       }
03479 
03480       // are we training in the sector with gun range in Alma?
03481       if ( (sMapX == GUN_RANGE_X) && (sMapY == GUN_RANGE_Y) && (bZ == GUN_RANGE_Z) )
03482       {
03483             fAtGunRange = TRUE;
03484       }
03485 
03486       // init trainer list
03487       memset( pStatTrainerList, 0, sizeof( pStatTrainerList ) );
03488 
03489       // build list of teammate trainers in this sector.
03490 
03491       // Only the trainer with the HIGHEST training ability in each stat is effective.  This is mainly to avoid having to
03492       // sort them from highest to lowest if some form of trainer degradation formula was to be used for multiple trainers.
03493 
03494       // for each trainable stat
03495       for (ubStat = 0; ubStat < NUM_TRAINABLE_STATS; ubStat++)
03496       {
03497             sBestTrainingPts = -1;
03498 
03499             // search team for active instructors in this sector
03500             for ( uiCnt = 0, pTrainer = MercPtrs[ uiCnt ]; uiCnt <= gTacticalStatus.Team[ MercPtrs[0] -> bTeam ].bLastID; uiCnt++, pTrainer++)
03501             {
03502                   if( pTrainer -> bActive && ( pTrainer -> sSectorX == sMapX ) && ( pTrainer -> sSectorY == sMapY ) && ( pTrainer -> bSectorZ == bZ) )
03503                   {
03504                         // if he's training teammates in this stat
03505                         if( ( pTrainer -> bAssignment == TRAIN_TEAMMATE ) && ( pTrainer -> bTrainStat == ubStat) && ( EnoughTimeOnAssignment( pTrainer ) ) && ( pTrainer->fMercAsleep == FALSE ) )
03506                         {
03507                               sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor = GetBonusTrainingPtsDueToInstructor( pTrainer, NULL, ubStat, fAtGunRange, &usMaxPts );
03508 
03509                               // if he's the best trainer so far for this stat
03510                               if (sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor > sBestTrainingPts)
03511                               {
03512                                     // then remember him as that, and the points he scored
03513                                     pStatTrainerList[ ubStat ] = pTrainer;
03514                                     sBestTrainingPts = sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor;
03515                               }
03516                         }
03517                   }
03518             }
03519       }
03520 
03521 
03522       // now search team for active self-trainers in this sector
03523       for ( uiCnt = 0, pStudent = MercPtrs[ uiCnt ]; uiCnt <= gTacticalStatus.Team[ MercPtrs[0] -> bTeam ].bLastID; uiCnt++, pStudent++)
03524       {
03525             // see if this merc is active and in the same sector
03526             if( ( pStudent -> bActive) && ( pStudent -> sSectorX == sMapX ) && ( pStudent -> sSectorY == sMapY ) && ( pStudent -> bSectorZ == bZ ) )
03527             {
03528                   // if he's training himself (alone, or by others), then he's a student
03529                   if ( ( pStudent -> bAssignment == TRAIN_SELF ) || ( pStudent -> bAssignment == TRAIN_BY_OTHER ) )
03530                   {
03531                         if ( EnoughTimeOnAssignment( pStudent ) && ( pStudent->fMercAsleep == FALSE ) )
03532                         {
03533                               // figure out how much the grunt can learn in one training period
03534                               sTotalTrainingPts = GetSoldierTrainingPts( pStudent, pStudent -> bTrainStat, fAtGunRange, &usMaxPts );
03535 
03536                               // if he's getting help
03537                               if ( pStudent -> bAssignment == TRAIN_BY_OTHER )
03538                               {
03539                                     // grab the pointer to the (potential) trainer for this stat
03540                                     pTrainer = pStatTrainerList[ pStudent -> bTrainStat ];
03541 
03542                                     // if this stat HAS a trainer in sector at all
03543                                     if (pTrainer != NULL)
03544                                     {
03545 /* Assignment distance limits removed.  Sep/11/98.  ARM
03546                                           // if this sector either ISN'T currently loaded, or it is but the trainer is close enough to the student
03547                                           if ( ( sMapX != gWorldSectorX ) || ( sMapY != gWorldSectorY ) || ( pStudent -> bSectorZ != gbWorldSectorZ ) ||
03548                                                        ( PythSpacesAway( pStudent -> sGridNo, pTrainer -> sGridNo ) < MAX_DISTANCE_FOR_TRAINING ) && ( EnoughTimeOnAssignment( pTrainer ) ) )
03549 */
03550                                           // NB this EnoughTimeOnAssignment() call is redundent since it is called up above
03551                                           //if ( EnoughTimeOnAssignment( pTrainer ) )
03552                                           {
03553                                                 // valid trainer is available, this gives the student a large training bonus!
03554                                                 sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor = GetBonusTrainingPtsDueToInstructor( pTrainer, pStudent, pStudent -> bTrainStat, fAtGunRange, &usMaxPts );
03555 
03556                                                 StatChange(pTrainer,LDRAMT,sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor,FALSE);
03557                                                 StatChange(pTrainer,WISDOMAMT,sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor,FALSE);
03558 
03559                                                 // add the bonus to what merc can learn on his own
03560                                                 sTotalTrainingPts += sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor;
03561                                           }
03562                                     }
03563                               }
03564 
03565                               // now finally train the grunt
03566                               TrainSoldierWithPts( pStudent, sTotalTrainingPts );
03567                         }
03568                   }
03569             }
03570       }
03571 
03572 
03573       // check if we're doing a sector where militia can be trained
03574       if( ( (StrategicMap[ sMapX + ( sMapY * MAP_WORLD_X ) ].bNameId != BLANK_SECTOR ) || ( fSamSiteInSector == TRUE ) ) && (bZ == 0) )
03575       {
03576             // init town trainer list
03577             memset( TownTrainer, 0, sizeof( TownTrainer ) );
03578             ubTownTrainers = 0;
03579 
03580             // build list of all the town trainers in this sector and their training pts
03581             for ( uiCnt = 0, pTrainer = MercPtrs[ uiCnt ]; uiCnt <= gTacticalStatus.Team[ MercPtrs[0] -> bTeam ].bLastID; uiCnt++,pTrainer++)
03582             {
03583                   if( pTrainer -> bActive && ( pTrainer -> sSectorX == sMapX ) && ( pTrainer -> sSectorY == sMapY ) && ( pTrainer -> bSectorZ == bZ ) )
03584                   {
03585                         if( ( pTrainer -> bAssignment == TRAIN_TOWN ) && ( EnoughTimeOnAssignment( pTrainer ) )  && ( pTrainer->fMercAsleep == FALSE ) )
03586                         {
03587                               sTownTrainingPts = GetTownTrainPtsForCharacter( pTrainer, &usMaxPts );
03588 
03589                               // if he's actually worth anything
03590                               if( sTownTrainingPts > 0 )
03591                               {
03592                                     // remember this guy as a town trainer
03593                                     TownTrainer[ubTownTrainers].sTrainingPts = sTownTrainingPts;
03594                                     TownTrainer[ubTownTrainers].pSoldier = pTrainer;
03595                                     ubTownTrainers++;
03596                               }
03597                         }
03598                   }
03599             }
03600 
03601 
03602             // if we have more than one
03603             if (ubTownTrainers > 1)
03604             {
03605                   // sort the town trainer list from best trainer to worst
03606                   qsort( TownTrainer, ubTownTrainers, sizeof(TOWN_TRAINER_TYPE), TownTrainerQsortCompare);
03607             }
03608 
03609             // for each trainer, in sorted order from the best to the worst
03610             for (uiCnt = 0; uiCnt < ubTownTrainers; uiCnt++)
03611             {
03612                   // top trainer has full effect (divide by 1), then divide by 2, 4, 8, etc.
03613                   //sTownTrainingPts = TownTrainer[ uiCnt ].sTrainingPts / (UINT16) pow(2, uiCnt);
03614                   // CJC: took this out and replaced with limit of 2 guys per sector
03615                   sTownTrainingPts = TownTrainer[ uiCnt ].sTrainingPts;
03616 
03617                   if (sTownTrainingPts > 0)
03618                   {
03619                         fTrainingCompleted = TrainTownInSector( TownTrainer[ uiCnt ].pSoldier, sMapX, sMapY, sTownTrainingPts );
03620                   
03621                         if ( fTrainingCompleted )
03622                         {
03623                               // there's no carryover into next session for extra training (cause player might cancel), so break out of loop
03624                               break;
03625                         }
03626                   }
03627             }
03628       }
03629 }
03630 
03631 
03632 int TownTrainerQsortCompare(const void *pArg1, const void *pArg2)
03633 {
03634   if (((TOWN_TRAINER_TYPE *)pArg1) -> sTrainingPts > ((TOWN_TRAINER_TYPE *)pArg2) -> sTrainingPts)
03635   {
03636     return(-1);
03637   }
03638   else
03639   if (((TOWN_TRAINER_TYPE *)pArg1) -> sTrainingPts < ((TOWN_TRAINER_TYPE *)pArg2) -> sTrainingPts)
03640   {
03641     return(1);
03642   }
03643   else
03644   {
03645     return(0);
03646   }
03647 }
03648 
03649 
03650 INT16 GetBonusTrainingPtsDueToInstructor( SOLDIERTYPE *pInstructor, SOLDIERTYPE *pStudent, INT8 bTrainStat, BOOLEAN fAtGunRange, UINT16 *pusMaxPts )
03651 {
03652       // return the bonus training pts of this instructor with this student,...if student null, simply assignment student skill of 0 and student wisdom of 100
03653       INT16 sTrainingPts = 0;
03654       INT8 bTraineeEffWisdom = 0;
03655       INT8 bTraineeNatWisdom = 0;
03656       INT8 bTraineeSkill = 0;
03657       INT8 bTrainerEffSkill = 0;
03658       INT8 bTrainerNatSkill = 0;
03659       INT8 bTrainingBonus = 0;
03660       INT8 bOpinionFactor;
03661 
03662       // assume training impossible for max pts
03663       *pusMaxPts = 0;
03664 
03665       if( pInstructor == NULL )
03666       {
03667             // no instructor, leave
03668             return ( 0 );
03669       }
03670 
03671 
03672       switch( bTrainStat )
03673       {
03674             case( STRENGTH ):
03675                   bTrainerEffSkill = EffectiveStrength ( pInstructor );
03676                   bTrainerNatSkill = pInstructor->bStrength;
03677             break;
03678             case( DEXTERITY ):
03679                   bTrainerEffSkill = EffectiveDexterity ( pInstructor );
03680                   bTrainerNatSkill = pInstructor->bDexterity;
03681             break;
03682             case( AGILITY ):
03683                   bTrainerEffSkill = EffectiveAgility( pInstructor );
03684                   bTrainerNatSkill = pInstructor->bAgility;
03685             break;
03686             case( HEALTH ):
03687                   bTrainerEffSkill = pInstructor -> bLifeMax;
03688                   bTrainerNatSkill = pInstructor->bLifeMax;
03689             break;
03690             case( LEADERSHIP ):
03691                   bTrainerEffSkill = EffectiveLeadership( pInstructor );
03692                   bTrainerNatSkill = pInstructor->bLeadership;
03693             break;
03694             case( MARKSMANSHIP ):
03695                   bTrainerEffSkill = EffectiveMarksmanship( pInstructor );
03696                   bTrainerNatSkill = pInstructor->bMarksmanship;
03697             break;
03698             case( EXPLOSIVE_ASSIGN ):
03699                   bTrainerEffSkill = EffectiveExplosive( pInstructor );
03700                   bTrainerNatSkill = pInstructor->bExplosive;
03701             break;
03702             case( MEDICAL ):
03703                   bTrainerEffSkill = EffectiveMedical( pInstructor );
03704                   bTrainerNatSkill = pInstructor->bMedical;
03705             break;
03706             case( MECHANICAL ):
03707                   bTrainerEffSkill = EffectiveMechanical( pInstructor );
03708                   bTrainerNatSkill = pInstructor->bMechanical;
03709             break;
03710             // NOTE: Wisdom can't be trained!
03711             default:
03712                   // BETA message
03713                   #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
03714                         ScreenMsg( FONT_ORANGE, MSG_BETAVERSION, L"GetBonusTrainingPtsDueToInstructor: ERROR - Unknown bTrainStat %d", bTrainStat);
03715                   #endif
03716                   return(0);
03717       }
03718 
03719 
03720       // if there's no student
03721       if( pStudent == NULL )
03722       {
03723             // assume these default values
03724         bTraineeEffWisdom = 100;
03725         bTraineeNatWisdom = 100;
03726         bTraineeSkill = 0;
03727             bOpinionFactor = 0;
03728       }
03729       else
03730       {
03731             // set student's variables
03732             bTraineeEffWisdom = EffectiveWisdom ( pStudent );
03733             bTraineeNatWisdom = pStudent->bWisdom;
03734             
03735             // for trainee's stat skill, must use the natural value, not the effective one, to avoid drunks training beyond cap
03736             switch( bTrainStat )
03737             {
03738                   case( STRENGTH ):
03739                         bTraineeSkill = pStudent -> bStrength;
03740                   break;
03741                   case( DEXTERITY ):
03742                         bTraineeSkill = pStudent -> bDexterity;
03743                   break;
03744                   case( AGILITY ):
03745                         bTraineeSkill = pStudent -> bAgility;
03746                   break;
03747                   case( HEALTH ):
03748                         bTraineeSkill = pStudent -> bLifeMax;
03749                   break;
03750                   case( LEADERSHIP ):
03751                         bTraineeSkill = pStudent -> bLeadership;
03752                   break;
03753                   case( MARKSMANSHIP ):
03754                         bTraineeSkill = pStudent -> bMarksmanship;
03755                   break;
03756                   case( EXPLOSIVE_ASSIGN ):
03757                         bTraineeSkill = pStudent -> bExplosive;
03758                   break;
03759                   case( MEDICAL ):
03760                         bTraineeSkill = pStudent -> bMedical;
03761                   break;
03762                   case( MECHANICAL ):
03763                         bTraineeSkill = pStudent -> bMechanical;
03764                   break;
03765                   // NOTE: Wisdom can't be trained!
03766                   default:
03767                         // BETA message
03768                         #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
03769                               ScreenMsg( FONT_ORANGE, MSG_BETAVERSION, L"GetBonusTrainingPtsDueToInstructor: ERROR - Unknown bTrainStat %d", bTrainStat);
03770                         #endif
03771                         return(0);
03772             }
03773 
03774             // if trainee skill 0 or at/beyond the training cap, can't train
03775 //Orig:           if ( ( bTraineeSkill == 0 ) || ( bTraineeSkill >= TRAINING_RATING_CAP ) )
03776             // Madd
03777             if ( bTraineeSkill < gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMin || bTraineeSkill >= gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMax )
03778             {
03779                   return 0;
03780             }
03781 
03782             // factor in their mutual relationship
03783             bOpinionFactor  = gMercProfiles[    pStudent->ubProfile ].bMercOpinion[ pInstructor->ubProfile ];
03784             bOpinionFactor += gMercProfiles[ pInstructor->ubProfile ].bMercOpinion[    pStudent->ubProfile ] / 2;
03785       }
03786 
03787 
03788       // check to see if student better than/equal to instructor's effective skill, if so, return 0
03789       // don't use natural skill - if the guy's too doped up to tell what he know, student learns nothing until sobriety returns!
03790       if( bTraineeSkill >= bTrainerEffSkill )
03791       {
03792             return ( 0 );
03793       }
03794 
03795       // calculate effective training pts
03796       sTrainingPts = ( bTrainerEffSkill - bTraineeSkill ) * ( bTraineeEffWisdom + ( EffectiveWisdom( pInstructor ) + EffectiveLeadership( pInstructor ) ) / 2 ) / gGameExternalOptions.ubInstructedTrainingDivisor;
03797 
03798       // calculate normal training pts - what it would be if his stats were "normal" (ignoring drugs, fatigue)
03799       *pusMaxPts   = ( bTrainerNatSkill - bTraineeSkill ) * ( bTraineeNatWisdom + ( pInstructor->bWisdom + pInstructor->bLeadership ) / 2 ) / gGameExternalOptions.ubInstructedTrainingDivisor;
03800 
03801       // put in a minimum (that can be reduced due to instructor being tired?)
03802       if (*pusMaxPts == 0)
03803       {
03804             // we know trainer is better than trainee, make sure they are at least 10 pts better
03805             if ( bTrainerEffSkill > bTraineeSkill + 10 )
03806             {
03807                   sTrainingPts = 1;
03808                   *pusMaxPts = 1;
03809             }
03810       }
03811 
03812       // check for teaching skill bonuses
03813       if( gMercProfiles[ pInstructor -> ubProfile ].bSkillTrait == TEACHING )
03814       {
03815             bTrainingBonus += gGameExternalOptions.ubTeachBonusToTrain;
03816       }
03817       if( gMercProfiles[ pInstructor -> ubProfile ].bSkillTrait2 == TEACHING )
03818       {
03819             bTrainingBonus += gGameExternalOptions.ubTeachBonusToTrain;
03820       }
03821 
03822       // teaching bonus is counted as normal, but gun range bonus is not
03823       *pusMaxPts += ( ( ( bTrainingBonus + bOpinionFactor ) * *pusMaxPts ) / 100 );
03824 
03825       // get special bonus if we're training marksmanship and we're in the gun range sector in Alma
03826       if ( ( bTrainStat == MARKSMANSHIP ) && fAtGunRange )
03827       {
03828             bTrainingBonus += gGameExternalOptions.ubGunRangeTrainingBonus;
03829       }
03830 
03831       // adjust for any training bonuses and for the relationship
03832       sTrainingPts += ( ( ( bTrainingBonus + bOpinionFactor ) * sTrainingPts ) / 100 );
03833 
03834       // adjust for instructor fatigue
03835       ReducePointsForFatigue( pInstructor, (UINT16 *)&sTrainingPts );
03836 
03837       return( sTrainingPts );
03838 }
03839 
03840 
03841 INT16 GetSoldierTrainingPts( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, INT8 bTrainStat, BOOLEAN fAtGunRange, UINT16 *pusMaxPts )
03842 {
03843       INT16 sTrainingPts = 0;
03844       INT8  bTrainingBonus = 0;
03845       INT8  bSkill = 0;
03846 
03847       // assume training impossible for max pts
03848       *pusMaxPts = 0;
03849 
03850       // use NATURAL not EFFECTIVE values here
03851       switch( bTrainStat )
03852       {
03853             case( STRENGTH ):
03854                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bStrength;
03855             break;
03856             case( DEXTERITY ):
03857                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bDexterity;
03858             break;
03859             case( AGILITY ):
03860                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bAgility;
03861             break;
03862             case( HEALTH ):
03863                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bLifeMax;
03864             break;
03865             case( LEADERSHIP ):
03866                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bLeadership;
03867             break;
03868             case( MARKSMANSHIP ):
03869                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bMarksmanship;
03870             break;
03871             case( EXPLOSIVE_ASSIGN ):
03872                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bExplosive;
03873             break;
03874             case( MEDICAL ):
03875                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bMedical;
03876             break;
03877             case( MECHANICAL ):
03878                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bMechanical;
03879             break;
03880             // NOTE: Wisdom can't be trained!
03881             default:
03882                   // BETA message
03883                   #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
03884                         ScreenMsg( FONT_ORANGE, MSG_BETAVERSION, L"GetSoldierTrainingPts: ERROR - Unknown bTrainStat %d", bTrainStat);
03885                   #endif
03886                         return(0);
03887       }
03888 
03889       // if skill 0 or at/beyond the training cap, can't train
03890       if ( ( bSkill < gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMin) || ( bSkill >= gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMax ) )
03891       {
03892             return 0;
03893       }
03894 
03895 
03896       // calculate normal training pts - what it would be if his stats were "normal" (ignoring drugs, fatigue)
03897       *pusMaxPts = __max( ( ( pSoldier->bWisdom * ( gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMax - bSkill ) ) / gGameExternalOptions.ubSelfTrainingDivisor ), 1 );     
03898 
03899       // calculate effective training pts
03900       sTrainingPts = __max( ( ( EffectiveWisdom( pSoldier ) * ( gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMax - bSkill ) ) / gGameExternalOptions.ubSelfTrainingDivisor ), 1 );
03901 
03902       // get special bonus if we're training marksmanship and we're in the gun range sector in Alma
03903       if ( ( bTrainStat == MARKSMANSHIP ) && fAtGunRange )
03904       {
03905             bTrainingBonus += gGameExternalOptions.ubGunRangeTrainingBonus;
03906       }
03907 
03908       // adjust for any training bonuses
03909       sTrainingPts += ( ( bTrainingBonus * sTrainingPts ) / 100 );
03910 
03911       // adjust for fatigue
03912       ReducePointsForFatigue( pSoldier, (UINT16 *)&sTrainingPts );
03913 
03914       return( sTrainingPts );
03915 }
03916 
03917 INT16 GetSoldierStudentPts( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, INT8 bTrainStat, BOOLEAN fAtGunRange, UINT16 *pusMaxPts )
03918 {
03919       INT16 sTrainingPts = 0;
03920       INT8  bTrainingBonus = 0;
03921       INT8  bSkill = 0;
03922 
03923       INT16 sBestTrainingPts, sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor;
03924       UINT16      usMaxTrainerPts, usBestMaxTrainerPts;
03925       UINT32      uiCnt;
03926       SOLDIERTYPE * pTrainer;
03927 
03928       // assume training impossible for max pts
03929       *pusMaxPts = 0;
03930 
03931       // use NATURAL not EFFECTIVE values here
03932       switch( bTrainStat )
03933       {
03934             case( STRENGTH ):
03935                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bStrength;
03936             break;
03937             case( DEXTERITY ):
03938                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bDexterity;
03939             break;
03940             case( AGILITY ):
03941                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bAgility;
03942             break;
03943             case( HEALTH ):
03944                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bLifeMax;
03945             break;
03946             case( LEADERSHIP ):
03947                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bLeadership;
03948             break;
03949             case( MARKSMANSHIP ):
03950                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bMarksmanship;
03951             break;
03952             case( EXPLOSIVE_ASSIGN ):
03953                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bExplosive;
03954             break;
03955             case( MEDICAL ):
03956                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bMedical;
03957             break;
03958             case( MECHANICAL ):
03959                   bSkill = pSoldier -> bMechanical;
03960             break;
03961             // NOTE: Wisdom can't be trained!
03962             default:
03963                   // BETA message
03964                   #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
03965             ScreenMsg( FONT_ORANGE, MSG_BETAVERSION, L"GetSoldierTrainingPts: ERROR - Unknown bTrainStat %d", bTrainStat);
03966                   #endif
03967       return(0);
03968       }
03969 
03970       // if skill 0 or at/beyond the training cap, can't train
03971       if ( bSkill < gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMin || bSkill >= gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMax )
03972       {
03973             return 0;
03974       }
03975 
03976 
03977       // calculate normal training pts - what it would be if his stats were "normal" (ignoring drugs, fatigue)
03978       *pusMaxPts = __max( ( ( pSoldier->bWisdom * ( gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMax - bSkill ) ) / gGameExternalOptions.ubSelfTrainingDivisor ), 1 );     
03979 
03980       // calculate effective training pts
03981       sTrainingPts = __max( ( ( EffectiveWisdom( pSoldier ) * ( gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMax - bSkill ) ) / gGameExternalOptions.ubSelfTrainingDivisor ), 1 );
03982 
03983       // get special bonus if we're training marksmanship and we're in the gun range sector in Alma
03984       if ( ( bTrainStat == MARKSMANSHIP ) && fAtGunRange )
03985       {
03986             bTrainingBonus += gGameExternalOptions.ubGunRangeTrainingBonus;
03987       }
03988 
03989       // adjust for any training bonuses
03990       sTrainingPts += ( ( bTrainingBonus * sTrainingPts ) / 100 );
03991 
03992       // adjust for fatigue
03993       ReducePointsForFatigue( pSoldier, (UINT16 *)&sTrainingPts );
03994 
03995 
03996       // now add in stuff for trainer
03997 
03998       // for each trainable stat
03999       sBestTrainingPts = -1;
04000 
04001       // search team for active instructors in this sector
04002       for ( uiCnt = 0, pTrainer = MercPtrs[ uiCnt ]; uiCnt <= gTacticalStatus.Team[ MercPtrs[0] -> bTeam ].bLastID; uiCnt++, pTrainer++)
04003       {
04004             if( pTrainer->bActive && ( pTrainer->sSectorX == pSoldier->sSectorX ) && ( pTrainer->sSectorY == pSoldier->sSectorY ) && ( pTrainer->bSectorZ == pSoldier->bSectorZ) )
04005             {
04006                   // if he's training teammates in this stat
04007                   // NB skip the EnoughTime requirement to display what the value should be even if haven't been training long yet...
04008                   if ( ( pTrainer->bAssignment == TRAIN_TEAMMATE ) && ( pTrainer->bTrainStat == bTrainStat) && ( pTrainer->fMercAsleep == FALSE ) )
04009                   {
04010                         sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor = GetBonusTrainingPtsDueToInstructor( pTrainer, pSoldier, bTrainStat, fAtGunRange, &usMaxTrainerPts );
04011 
04012                         // if he's the best trainer so far for this stat
04013                         if (sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor > sBestTrainingPts)
04014                         {
04015                               // then remember him as that, and the points he scored
04016                               sBestTrainingPts = sTrainingPtsDueToInstructor;
04017                               usBestMaxTrainerPts = usMaxTrainerPts;
04018                         }
04019                   }
04020             }
04021       }
04022 
04023       if ( sBestTrainingPts != -1 )
04024       {
04025             // add the bonus to what merc can learn on his own
04026             sTrainingPts += sBestTrainingPts;
04027             *pusMaxPts += usBestMaxTrainerPts;
04028       }
04029 
04030       return( sTrainingPts );
04031 }
04032 
04033 
04034 
04035 void TrainSoldierWithPts( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, INT16 sTrainPts )
04036 {
04037       UINT8 ubChangeStat = 0;
04038 
04039       if( sTrainPts <= 0 )
04040       {
04041             return;
04042       }
04043       
04044       BOOLEAN addWis = FALSE;
04045       // which stat to modify?      
04046       switch( pSoldier -> bTrainStat )
04047       {
04048             case( STRENGTH ):
04049                   ubChangeStat = STRAMT;
04050                   break;
04051             case( DEXTERITY ):
04052                   ubChangeStat = DEXTAMT;
04053                   break;
04054             case( AGILITY ):
04055                   ubChangeStat = AGILAMT;
04056                   break;
04057             case( HEALTH ):
04058                   ubChangeStat = HEALTHAMT;
04059                   break;
04060             case( LEADERSHIP ):
04061                   ubChangeStat = LDRAMT;
04062                   addWis = TRUE;
04063                   break;
04064             case( MARKSMANSHIP ):
04065                   ubChangeStat = MARKAMT;
04066                   addWis = TRUE;
04067                   break;
04068             case( EXPLOSIVE_ASSIGN ):
04069                   ubChangeStat = EXPLODEAMT;
04070                   addWis = TRUE;
04071                   break;
04072             case( MEDICAL ):
04073                   ubChangeStat = MEDICALAMT;
04074                   addWis = TRUE;
04075                   break;
04076             case( MECHANICAL ):
04077                   ubChangeStat = MECHANAMT;
04078                   addWis = TRUE;
04079                   break;
04080             // NOTE: Wisdom can't be trained!
04081             default:
04082                   // BETA message
04083                   #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
04084             ScreenMsg( FONT_ORANGE, MSG_BETAVERSION, L"TrainSoldierWithPts: ERROR - Unknown bTrainStat %d", pSoldier -> bTrainStat);
04085                   #endif
04086       return;
04087       }
04088 
04089       // give this merc a few chances to increase a stat (TRUE means it's training, reverse evolution doesn't apply)
04090       StatChange( pSoldier, ubChangeStat, sTrainPts, FROM_TRAINING );
04091       if (addWis) 
04092             StatChange( pSoldier, WISDOMAMT, sTrainPts/2, FROM_TRAINING );
04093 
04094 }
04095 
04096 
04097 // will train a town in sector by character
04098 BOOLEAN TrainTownInSector( SOLDIERTYPE *pTrainer, INT16 sMapX, INT16 sMapY, INT16 sTrainingPts )
04099 {
04100       SECTORINFO *pSectorInfo = &( SectorInfo[ SECTOR( sMapX, sMapY ) ] );
04101       UINT8 ubTownId = 0;
04102       INT16 sCnt = 0;
04103       INT8 bChance = 0;
04104       BOOLEAN fSamSiteInSector = FALSE;
04105 
04106 
04107       // find out if a sam site here
04108       fSamSiteInSector = IsThisSectorASAMSector( sMapX, sMapY, 0 );
04109 
04110       // get town index
04111       ubTownId = StrategicMap[ pTrainer -> sSectorX + pTrainer -> sSectorY * MAP_WORLD_X ].bNameId;
04112       if( fSamSiteInSector == FALSE )
04113       {
04114             Assert(ubTownId != BLANK_SECTOR);
04115       }
04116 
04117       // trainer gains leadership - training argument is FALSE, because the trainer is not the one training!
04118       StatChange( pTrainer, LDRAMT,        (UINT16) ( 1 + ( sTrainingPts / 200 ) ), FALSE );
04119       StatChange( pTrainer, WISDOMAMT, (UINT16) ( 1 + ( sTrainingPts / 400 ) ), FALSE );
04120 
04121 
04122       // increase town's training completed percentage
04123       pSectorInfo -> ubMilitiaTrainingPercentDone += (sTrainingPts / 100);
04124       pSectorInfo -> ubMilitiaTrainingHundredths  += (sTrainingPts % 100);
04125 
04126       if (pSectorInfo -> ubMilitiaTrainingHundredths >= 100)
04127       {
04128             pSectorInfo -> ubMilitiaTrainingPercentDone++;
04129             pSectorInfo -> ubMilitiaTrainingHundredths -= 100;
04130       }
04131 
04132       // NOTE: Leave this at 100, change TOWN_TRAINING_RATE if necessary.  This value gets reported to player as a %age!
04133       if( pSectorInfo -> ubMilitiaTrainingPercentDone >= 100 )
04134       {
04135             // zero out training completion - there's no carryover to the next training session
04136             pSectorInfo -> ubMilitiaTrainingPercentDone = 0;
04137             pSectorInfo -> ubMilitiaTrainingHundredths  = 0;
04138 
04139             // make the player pay again next time he wants to train here
04140             pSectorInfo -> fMilitiaTrainingPaid = FALSE;
04141 
04142             TownMilitiaTrainingCompleted( pTrainer, sMapX, sMapY );
04143 
04144             // training done
04145             return( TRUE );
04146       }
04147       else
04148       {
04149             // not done
04150             return ( FALSE );
04151       }
04152 }
04153 
04154 
04155 INT16 GetTownTrainPtsForCharacter( SOLDIERTYPE *pTrainer, UINT16 *pusMaxPts )
04156 {
04157       INT16 sTotalTrainingPts = 0;
04158       INT8 bTrainingBonus = 0;
04159 //    UINT8 ubTownId = 0;
04160 
04161       // calculate normal training pts - what it would be if his stats were "normal" (ignoring drugs, fatigue)
04162       *pusMaxPts = ( pTrainer -> bWisdom + pTrainer -> bLeadership + ( 10 * pTrainer -> bExpLevel ) ) * gGameExternalOptions.ubTownMilitiaTrainingRate;
04163 
04164       // calculate effective training points (this is hundredths of pts / hour)
04165       // typical: 300/hr, maximum: 600/hr
04166       sTotalTrainingPts = ( EffectiveWisdom( pTrainer ) + EffectiveLeadership ( pTrainer ) + ( 10 * EffectiveExpLevel ( pTrainer ) ) ) * gGameExternalOptions.ubTownMilitiaTrainingRate;
04167 
04168       // check for teaching bonuses
04169       if( gMercProfiles[ pTrainer -> ubProfile ].bSkillTrait == TEACHING )
04170       {
04171             bTrainingBonus += gGameExternalOptions.ubTeachBonusToTrain;
04172       }
04173       if( gMercProfiles[ pTrainer -> ubProfile ].bSkillTrait2 == TEACHING )
04174       {
04175             bTrainingBonus += gGameExternalOptions.ubTeachBonusToTrain;
04176       }
04177 
04178       // RPCs get a small training bonus for being more familiar with the locals and their customs/needs than outsiders
04179       if( pTrainer->ubProfile >= FIRST_RPC )
04180       {
04181             bTrainingBonus += gGameExternalOptions.ubRpcBonusToTrainMilitia;
04182       }
04183 
04184       // adjust for teaching bonus (a percentage)
04185       sTotalTrainingPts += ( ( bTrainingBonus * sTotalTrainingPts ) / 100 );
04186       // teach bonus is considered "normal" - it's always there
04187       *pusMaxPts                    += ( ( bTrainingBonus * *pusMaxPts        ) / 100 );
04188 
04189 
04190       // adjust for fatigue of trainer
04191       ReducePointsForFatigue( pTrainer, (UINT16 *)&sTotalTrainingPts );
04192 
04193 
04194 /* ARM: Decided this didn't make much sense - the guys I'm training damn well BETTER be loyal - and screw the rest!
04195       // get town index
04196       ubTownId = StrategicMap[ pTrainer -> sSectorX + pTrainer -> sSectorY * MAP_WORLD_X ].bNameId;
04197       Assert(ubTownId != BLANK_SECTOR);
04198 
04199       // adjust for town loyalty
04200       sTotalTrainingPts = (sTotalTrainingPts * gTownLoyalty[ ubTownId ].ubRating) / 100;
04201 */
04202 
04203       return( sTotalTrainingPts );
04204 }
04205 
04206 
04207 void MakeSoldiersTacticalAnimationReflectAssignment( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier )
04208 {
04209       // soldier is in tactical, world loaded, he's OKLIFE
04210       if( ( pSoldier -> bInSector ) && gfWorldLoaded && ( pSoldier -> bLife >= OKLIFE ) )
04211       {
04212             // Set animation based on his assignment
04213             if ( pSoldier -> bAssignment == DOCTOR )
04214             {
04215                   SoldierInSectorDoctor( pSoldier, pSoldier -> usStrategicInsertionData );                        
04216             }
04217             else if ( pSoldier -> bAssignment == PATIENT )
04218             {
04219                   SoldierInSectorPatient( pSoldier, pSoldier -> usStrategicInsertionData );                       
04220             }
04221             else if ( pSoldier -> bAssignment == REPAIR )
04222             {
04223                   SoldierInSectorRepair( pSoldier, pSoldier -> usStrategicInsertionData );                        
04224             }
04225             else
04226             {
04227       if ( pSoldier->usAnimState != WKAEUP_FROM_SLEEP && !(pSoldier->bOldAssignment < ON_DUTY ) )
04228       {
04229                         // default: standing
04230                         ChangeSoldierState( pSoldier, STANDING, 1, TRUE );
04231       }
04232             }
04233       }
04234 }
04235 
04236 
04237 
04238 void AssignmentAborted( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, UINT8 ubReason )
04239 {
04240       Assert( ubReason < NUM_ASSIGN_ABORT_REASONS );
04241 
04242       ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_LTYELLOW, MSG_INTERFACE, gzLateLocalizedString[ ubReason ], pSoldier->name );
04243 
04244       StopTimeCompression();
04245 
04246       // update mapscreen 
04247       fCharacterInfoPanelDirty = TRUE;
04248       fTeamPanelDirty = TRUE;
04249       fMapScreenBottomDirty = TRUE;
04250 }
04251 
04252 
04253 
04254 void AssignmentDone( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, BOOLEAN fSayQuote, BOOLEAN fMeToo )
04255 {
04256       if ( ( pSoldier -> bInSector ) && ( gfWorldLoaded ) )
04257       {
04258             if ( pSoldier -> bAssignment == DOCTOR )
04259             {
04260                   if ( guiCurrentScreen == GAME_SCREEN )
